isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book for Models Built January 2001 to February 28, 2007 - Electrical Features - Electrical System Controller (ESC) - Electrical System Controller (3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7000 Models)

svcprocinfo.para: At the center of the Diamond Logic™ Electrical System is the Electrical System Controller (ESC). The ESC is an electronic module that provides multiple analog and switched input/output interfaces to monitor vehicle sensors and control vehicle functions through solid state switches, relay driver outputs and serial data communications. Serial data links connected to the ESC include:

item.para: A Drivetrain J1939 data link to communicate information between the engine, transmission, ABS, the ESC and the instrument panel.
A Switch Data Link for communicating switch status between the rocker switch assemblies (in the instrument panel and the switches in the door pods) and the ESC.
A Body Builder Data Link to interface optional input/output modules with the ESC.

svcprocinfo.para: The ESC is located under the instrument panel on the driver's side and is attached to the cab dash panel. It has connections to the dash harness in the engine compartment and to the instrument panel harness inside the cab. The ESC receives battery power from the maxi-fuse block and ignition power from the instrument panel harness.

note.para: Pin 3 of the cab 36-way connector (1600) and pin 26 of the chassis 36-way connector (4004) are the Zero Volt Reference for various sensors on the vehicle and should NEVER have battery voltage applied to them. Doing so will permanently damage the ESC. Do not connect other ground signals to the Zero Volt Reference.

svcsubproc.title: Standard Interface Signals
svcsubproc.para: The ESC provides standard interface signals for Park Brake Set, Dome Light and Brake Applied. These interface signals are described at the end of this section.

para.emph: WARNING: NO CONNECTIONS OR SPLICES ARE ALLOWABLE ON ANY SIGNALS THAT ARE HIGHLIGHTED IN BOLD ITALIC BELOW.

entry.para: * The circuit attached to this pin should NOT have additional connections or splices added on an air chassis.
Note: All outputs will handle up to a 500 mAmp load unless stated otherwise.
Note: Circuits labeled "Gnd Active", "12v Active", or "5v Active" are open circuit until active.

para.emph: No connections or splices are allowable on any signals that are highlighted in bold italic.
PTO Hour Meter OR Manual Transmission Oil Temp
PTO Hour Meter OR Manual Transmission Oil Temp

entry.para: Reverse Gear Monitor for Lift Axle (7000 Series)
Reverse Gear Monitor for Lift Axle (7000 Series)
* The circuit attached to this pin should NOT have additional connections or splices added on a hydraulic chassis.
Note: All outputs will handle up to a 500 mAmp load unless stated otherwise.
Note: Circuits labeled "Gnd Active", "12v Active", or "5v Active" are open circuit until active.

para.emph: No connections or splices are allowable on any signals that are highlighted in bold italic.
